Overall, an amazing place to stay. It was absolutely gorgeous, no neighbors close by or any crowding, and just a spectacular view. There were a few things that we think would help others to know, though.
The water pressure for the shower is just awful. The heat is fine, but it's basically a trickle. You can still shower, but be ready to bundle up immediately afterward!
The size is cozier than we first thought. It ended up being great for a couple, but I can't imagine actually fitting 3-4 people in here unless you're all very close (2 on a bed, 1 on the couch, 1 on an inflatable mattress).
The stairs are incredibly steep due to the size of the cabin (not enough room to make them a gradual slope). I'd consider them more of a ladder than stairs. If you have mobility issues, it may be difficult to get up and downstairs (especially to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night).
Overall, a great stay. There was coffee, cooking supplies, and great heat. Honestly, an amazing place!
